projects.title: CubeSat ADCS Concept and Simulation
projects.summary: Attitude determination and control system concept development and simulation workflow for a 3U-class CubeSat mission.

photos.caption: ADCS concept overview and end-to-end simulation workflow.
Control loop block diagram used for architecture evaluation.

whatIDid: Defined attitude control requirements and pointing error budget for a 3U CubeSat mission concept.
Developed a repeatable simulation workflow to evaluate candidate sensor and actuator configurations under representative orbital disturbance scenarios.
Documented modeling assumptions, test cases, and verification checks to support consistent architecture comparison.
results: Produced a quantitative down-select matrix comparing multiple ADCS architectures.
Validated system stability and pointing performance against defined mission scenarios in simulation.

projects.title: Pulsejet Engine Design and Testing
projects.summary: Design, fabrication, and bench testing of a propane-fueled pulsejet engine prototype.

photos.caption: Bench test configuration for the pulsejet prototype.
CAD model used to iterate combustion chamber and inlet geometry prior to fabrication.

whatIDid: Designed and fabricated a propane-fueled pulsejet prototype using manual machining, welding, and assembly processes.
Designed a controlled propellant delivery system to regulate flow rate and inlet pressure during operation.
Conducted bench testing to evaluate ignition stability, operating behavior, and thermal response.
results: Achieved sustained pulsejet operation during bench testing.
Identified combustion stability and thermal constraints that informed iterative design refinements.

projects.title: Bioelectric Signal Processing for Embedded Rover Control
projects.summary: Embedded system that processes EEG and EMG bioelectric signals to control a mobile robotic platform.

photos.caption: Mobile rover platform used for signal-controlled testing.
Captured EEG and EMG waveforms used for signal characterization.
System integration and testing of signal-driven control logic.

whatIDid: Developed signal-processing logic to extract frequency-domain features from EEG and EMG measurements.
Implemented embedded control mapping between extracted signal features and rover motion states.
Standardized test setup and data collection procedures to improve repeatability.
results: Achieved consistent rover response under controlled test conditions.
Identified transient overshoot behavior and proposed mitigation strategies through control logic refinement.

projects.title: Studdy Buddy Web Application
projects.summary: Full-stack educational web application designed to improve study engagement through interactive game-based review modes.

photos.caption: Web interface showing interactive study modes.

whatIDid: Designed and implemented the full-stack architecture including front end, backend, and database integration.
Developed structured game logic with real-time feedback, scoring, and randomized content generation.
Designed a relational database schema to support scalable content storage and retrieval.
results: Delivered a responsive and reliable study tool with consistent content retrieval and validation.
Improved user engagement through measurable progress tracking and feedback mechanisms.

projects.title: AccelSpin High-Speed Rotational Launcher
projects.summary: Design and fabrication of a high-speed rotational system capable of launching projectiles using stored rotational energy.

photos.caption: Spindle and release mechanism used for projectile deployment.

whatIDid: Designed and fabricated a rotational launcher driven by a high-torque electric motor.
Implemented tunable speed control to adjust launch energy based on projectile mass and target altitude.
Incorporated vibration mitigation and safety constraints for high-speed operation.
results: Achieved repeatable vertical launch trajectories through controlled release timing.
Maintained stable operation up to 1000 RPM following vibration control improvements.

projects.title: Autonomous Control Systems for Model Rocketry
projects.summary: Design and flight testing of reusable model rockets with embedded thrust vector control and deployable airbrake systems.

photos.caption: Reusable rocket integrating TVC and airbrake subsystems.

whatIDid: Designed and built a servo-actuated gimbal system to provide thrust vector control during powered ascent.
Engineered deployable airbrakes to increase drag near apogee while maintaining vehicle stability.
Integrated embedded control logic coordinating propulsion-based and aerodynamic control across flight phases.
results: Enabled real-time trajectory correction during powered flight through thrust vectoring.
Improved ascent consistency and altitude control using combined TVC and airbrake strategies.

projects.title: Mechanical Impact Mitigation System
projects.summary: Design and validation of a spring-damper impact mitigation system to reduce peak acceleration during drop tests.

photos.caption: Two-layer spring-damper structure used for drop testing.

whatIDid: Designed a two-layer spring-damper system to extend deceleration time and reduce peak impact loads.
Calculated effective stiffness and damping values and modeled expected dynamic response.
Validated performance through physical drop testing under mass and height constraints.
results: Final system mass of 2.14 kg excluding payload.
Measured effective stiffness of 4370 N/m and damping of 480 N per m per s.
Successfully protected payload during repeated drop tests.
